comment.author: 12503706@N08
comment._content: This is the view looking west, across Carrick Roads and the mouth of the Fal Estuary.  On the near headland, the top of St Mawes Castle can just been seen, guarding the entrance to Falmouth.  Its larger sister is Pendennis Castle on the Falmouth side of the estuary, which completed the defensive arrangements with overlapping fields of cannon fire to dissuade the French from raiding.
